snippet: General Motors’ chief executive, Daniel Akerson, said the company could discuss pension buyouts with the U.A.W. before the current contract expires in 2015.
abstract: General Motors says it may seek a deal before the current United Automobile Workers contract expires in 2015 to offer pension buyouts to union retirees similar to offers made recently to 42,000 white-collar retirees; automaker hopes to reduces its $134 billion long-term global pension obligations by $26 billion with such lump-sum payouts.
lead_paragraph: General Motors’ chief executive, Daniel Akerson, said the company could discuss pension buyouts with the U.A.W. before the current contract expires in 2015.

headline.main: G.M. Says It May Propose Pension Buyouts to Union
headline.print_headline: G.M. Says It May Propose Pension Buyouts to Union
